content:
There are several resources available to track basketball performance, including stats trackers and scorekeepers. Here are a few options:

1. Basketball Apps:
	* GameChanger: A popular app that allows you to track scores, stats, and play-by-play for basketball games. It also provides detailed analysis and team management tools.
	* Basketball Scorekeeper: A simple app that allows you to track scores, fouls, and timeouts. It also provides a summary of team and player performance.
	* Hoopstat: A comprehensive app that tracks team and player stats, including points, rebounds, assists, and more. It also provides game and season summaries.
2. Online Platforms:
	* Hudl: A web-based platform that provides video analysis and stats tracking for basketball teams. It allows you to upload game footage and track player performance.
	* SportsCode: A platform that provides video analysis and stats tracking for basketball teams. It also offers coaching tools and team management features.
	* Basketball-Reference.com: A website that provides detailed stats and analysis for college and professional basketball players. You can use it to track your own performance or compare yourself to other players.
3. Wearable Devices:
	* ShotTracker: A wearable device that tracks your shots, including makes, misses, and percentages. It provides real-time feedback and analysis to help you improve your shooting.
	* Catapult Sports: A wearable device that tracks your speed, distance, and acceleration during games and practices. It provides detailed analysis and insights to help you improve your performance.
4. Spreadsheets or Notebooks:
	* Create your own spreadsheet or notebook to track your performance. You can record your scores, stats, and notes about your game. This can be a simple and low-tech way to track your progress.

These are just a few examples of the resources available to track basketball performance. You may want to try out a few options to see which one works best for you.
